name: RAIGEKI - The Lightning Strike: (MONK 20/ FTR 4/ WM 16)
author: Valerfor

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Another Sword Saint for your consideration,

Mind you, this one is a bit more aggressive though. Taken directly from the Lion' Pride Berserkers this warrior will destroy anything ih her path in quick succession.

16 Wmaster lvls boost her AB to a net 45 & this comes along with devastating critical.

She still has good saves, the speed of a hurricane, full stealth abilities for Alpha strikes (IKD-Dev. Criticals) with her No-Dachi and a moderate ammount of 30 SR to resist the dabblers in magical arts.

And of course she is immune to many things, other warriors would fail. Things like the fear of a dragon or a stun from a spellcaster are beneath her, she just ignores them while she delivers the punishment.

Here she is,

posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content: They REALLY should have made the Katana a 2-hander. That being said, I have made a few "Kensai" Warrior/Monks and I generally start them on the warrior level and do the first monk at level 2 (they get the extra AC from Tumble 5 and usually don't need Evasion at Level 1. If you've even played the "Ronin: Kensai of Kyoto" module the No-Dachi animations are cool!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
They messed up many things, not only the weapons but at least in servers with CEP you can always craft your Greatsword to look like a No-Dachi (this is what i have done). Yeah i know that's not ideal either but it is the only option we have for a two-handed katana. Ideally katana should be a finessable weapon and it is much-much better represented in systems that is not D20 but D10 (Legend of the Five Rings R.P.G), there you use your agility to hit someone and katana gives you an initiative bonus as well because it is so fast a weapon.

You are right about the evasion, normally you don't need that at first level, but this way i could take more skill points Fist.

It is always nice to see fellow Kensai enthusiasts!

posts.author: Cornflower
posts.content: OK. I'm confused. This looks like an excellent build, except: She's gonna die horribly in the first fight, due to low AC and no DR at all. Regardless of all the immunities, with 26 AC and perhaps a few points more due to items, she's doomed. What am I missing? Is this a full plate build? How is she going to survive?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
You forget her abilities...
The ability to raise her AC by as much as 12 points by maxing-out her wisdom & dexterity,
The ability to make her 50% concealed for 20 rounds 2/day (non-dispellable),
Her Monk super speed (that gets multiplied by haste) so she can avoid anything that isn't to her liking,
Her innate immunity to all mind-effects spells or abilities,
Her expertise feat,

Typical AC in a moderate +5 magic world,
26 (base) +4 (haste) +20 (items) +12 (maxed dexterity & wisdom) +5 (expertise) +1 (dodge) = 67/68 AC.
If you don't want to use expertise, she still has 62/63 AC, which is about equal - or slightly better than a full-plate & shield warrior with full tumble ranks has,
And she hits much-much harder than most people, (30 Str & ews & dev. crit & Ikd).

One thing that she isn't. Static.
You need to move your fingers when you play her, you don't just sit there like a normal warrior does in full plate & shield does and wait for the combat to finish while drinking your occasional heal pot.
Here, you have so many options that it is almost always better to do something more in your round, either activate your etherealness ability, or Ikd your opponent or activate expertise or move in-or-out of combat should you get surrounded etc.
Here, you do have the options to react to almost everything your opponents can do. Heck, you could even hide & move silently with the speed that others run for that matter!

Thanks for commenting on the build Cornflower & welcome to Neverwinter Nights ECB guild.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Optional modification for those that don't necessarily want Dev. crit. and need better defences instead plus more skills,

Start with Str 15(30), Int(14), Wis(14) all others stay the same,
Instead of taking Overwhelming critical at 25th level, get Armour skin, then at 30th & 33rd levels get two more Great strengths,
Same overall Strength, same Damage, same Attack bonus but +2 AC & +2 Will & 43(45) ranks in Spot.
The weapon is a matter of taste but if I didn't have Dev. crit. then I would probably go for a Greataxe for those nasty X4 criticals.

I have several other lvl 40 toons, but I haven't found the one that feels right, so I was looking for something like this. Thank you!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Katana should NEVER be a finesse weapon!

It's a myth that a Katana is "fast" - it isn't any faster than the typical longsword.

Katana     Mass    1.1–1.5 kg Blade length    Approx. 60–80 cm (23.62–31.5 in)
Blade type    Curved, single-edged

A longsword (also spelled as long sword or long-sword) is a type of European sword characterized as having a cruciform hilt with a grip for two-handed use (around 16 to 28 cm or 6 to 11 in), a straight double-edged blade of around 85 to 110 cm (33 to 43 in), and weighing approximately 1 to 1.5 kg

As one can see, they weight about the same.

Compared to an Epee or Rapier, the Katana is heavier.

The modern épée is a thrusting weapon 770 g (27.16 oz) in weight and 110 cm (3.6 ft) in overall length, with a blade 90 cm (nearly 3 ft) long. The blade is triangular in cross section and fairly rigid, tapering to a sharp point blunted with a stop, or button.
Rapier / espada ropera
Mass avg. 1 kg (2.2 lb)
Blade length avg. 104 cm (41 in)
Width avg. 2.5 cm (0.98 in) to sharp point
Blade type single or double edged, straight blade
So as one can plainly see, the Katana should NEVER, EVER be a finesse weapon.

That said, it is entirely possible now, thanks to BD, to make a Katana finesseable (and to make a Nodachi, a real one) - that has all the appropriate weapon feats, etc.  It does require some 2da edits, however.
